item.title: Designer UX pour Prototypage Rapide
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

We’re looking for a Senior Designer to join our growing team!

What you’ll do here:

  • Craft human-centred experiences that help achieve business objectives.
  • Give a voice to our customers through design research.
  • Produce any user experience deliverables required to propel projects forward.
  • Drive a roadmap alongside a product manager and an agile multidisciplinary team.
  • Present work to executives and stakeholders.
  • Help engineers produce quality, delightful interfaces.
  • Be an advocate for user-centred, data-driven design.


What you bring to the table:

  • At least 10 years of experience as a UX Designer or Lead UX Designer.
  • Expertise in usability and user-centred design practices.
  • Capacity to understand business needs and to translate them into design requirements.
  • Mastery of design tools (Sketch, Axure, Figma, etc.).
  • Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.).
  • Experience in producing process flows, content inventories, etc.
  • Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious.
  • Team player that can share and receive constructive feedback.
  • You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders.
  • Deeply passionate about design and quality.
  • Organized, fully autonomous and proactive.

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

item.title: UI System Designer
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Are you passionate about design systems? Stacking components, identifying standards and guidelines, educating users and letting your work live in a multi-brand digital product ecosystem. White labelling, design token and pixel-perfect are some words that fuel your brain. We\'ve got the ideal opportunity for you!

Role

As a System Designer, you play a critical role in the mission of iceberg, Intact\'s design system. You will report to the Design System Studio Manager and collaborate with our UI designers, UX developers, and writers. You\'ll help spruce up our multi-brand libraries, grow the design system culture, and improve our style guides and documentation. As a System Designer, you will:  
 

  • In a white labelling methodology, interpret brand books and build elements that can be applied to 5+ brands.

  • Document in-depth the designs and rules of use for the components and elements in the design system.

  • Ensure the maintenance, continuous improvement and justification of the decisions taken vis-à-vis the design system.

  • Promote updates and enhancements of the design system during weekly presentations, creative meetings, and more.

  • Conduct user tests and interviews to validate new elements.

  • Be an advocate for the design system and participate in design communities within the Lab.

You Should Apply If

  • You\'ve helped create a design system and contributed to improving DesignOps.

  • You excel at creating/evolving enterprise UI design but understand that you’re not an Art Director.

  • You have a solid working knowledge of accessibility guidelines (WCAG).

  • You understand front-end code and the limitations of front-end technology. You can demonstrate this by understanding the needs of the developers you\'ve worked with previously.

  • You\'ve worked for a company that builds and maintains digital products.

  • You\'re humble and able to freely discuss your strengths and weaknesses (and those of others), but always in a kind, professional, and appropriate way.

  • Our values of integrity, respect, customer-driven, excellence and generosity resonate with you.

  • You enjoy collaborating with a cross-functional team.

Qualifications

  • At least seven years of experience linked to UI design.

  • Expertise in building and maintaining design systems.

  • Mastery of design tools, Figma (primary tool), but may need to use others (Axure, Adobe products, etc.).

  • Experience with UX research tools an assets (usertesting.com).

  • You love working in a collaborative environment with a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun.

  • You have a solid ability to think technically, with knowledge of patterns for responsive
    design and native mobile.

You are

  • Creative, analytical and loving when elements are well aligned in a file.

  • A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback.

  • You understand why it’s important to name each layer of your files

  • Excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders.

  • Deeply passionate about design and quality.

  • Organized and proactive.

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

item.title: Senior Machine Learning Software Developer, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Calling all AI and machine learning experts! We have a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Senior Machine Learning Software Developer to join our team.

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our lab turns this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.

As a tech pioneer within an AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Use machine learning and advanced statistics to help build innovative solutions for real-life customer and business problems

  • Develop and deploy to production data and machine learning pipeline at scale

  • Influence the AI roadmap for the largest home, auto business insurer in Canada

  • Explore new technologies and use them in your own solutions

  • Validate the analytical approach and project outputs of other team members

  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business and design

  • Mentor and coach interns and other engineers to help us grow, as a team

  • Need to interact on a regular basis with colleagues across the country

All this plus great work-life balance!

  • A bachelor’s degree in a discipline such as computer science, software engineering, AI, or a related field. MSc is an asset

  • Significant experience of at least 5 years in software development

  • 3+ years of experience solving business problem using machine learning

  • Expertise in programming in languages such as Python and machine learning libraries such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, etc.

  • Expertise with the machine learning development lifecycle

  • Experience developing data and machine learning pipelines

  • Familiar with the underlying theory of machine learning (supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning)

  • Unlimited curiosity and the desire to challenge the status quo

  • You can take a vaguely defined issue and bring it to life using a creative approach

  • Strong communication, time management and work organization skills

  • The passion for developing world-class data products

Some nice-to-haves:

  • Knowledge of DevOps modern tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, ELK;

  • Knowledge of our tech stack: xgboost, LightGBM, Flask, MongoDB, Kafka

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team: 

  • An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work 

  • Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career

  • A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success

item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. About the role

We are looking for future talent who would like to grow with us. If you think the Actuarial Analyst internship is for you and you\'re interested in becoming part of the Intact family, then please read the following and send us your application today!

Work terms: Summer or Fall 2023 

Job Location: 

Montréal (2020 boul. Robert-Bourassa) 

St-Hyacinthe (2450 Girouard Ouest) 

Québec (5700 boul. des Galeries) 

What you’ll do here: 

• Support the company\'s strategy by tracking the profitability and competitiveness of our insurance portfolios and helping to prepare an action plan for the coming years. 

• Use actuarial techniques to ensure that the Company has adequate loss reserves and reinsurance as well as a sufficient amount of capital to respond to various catastrophe scenarios. 

• Contribute to the company\'s innovation initiatives in machine learning, customer experience, usage-based insurance and climate change. 

• Support other departments like Underwriting, Marketing, Risk Management and Finance. 

Qualifications 

What you bring to the table: 

• Have an excellent ability to adapt to change 

• Can work in teams 

• Can work independently and have a sense of responsibility

These are the requirements to apply:

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.

At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. About the role

We are looking for an experienced iOS and Android Developer for our new Rapid Prototyping team. This team\'s mission is to quickly assess the feasibility, desirability and viability of innovative features or technologies through the design, development, and implementation of functional prototypes. 

Responsibilities : 

As a Senior iOS and Android Developer, you will play an essential role in developing functional prototypes in a fast-paced environment. Reporting to the Manager of the Rapid Prototyping team, your main responsibilities will be: 

  • Conceive and build native mobile apps for iOS and Android 

  • Define and oversee application architecture 

  • Ensure performance, quality, and security of applications 

  • Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team throughout product design and development

  • Be on the lookout for new technologies; learn and apply new technologies and processes in real-world projects 

  • Participate in the ideation process for future projects 

  • Challenge the status quo 

You are : 

  • Autonomous, proactive, curious, and resourceful. You are a fast learner.  

  • Adaptable 

  • Motivated by challenges and an accelerated pace of work 

  • A team player who can share and receive constructive feedback 

  • An advocate for quality 

  • Able to work in French and English 

Ideal candidate :

item.title: Annotateur (Temporaire - 6 mois)
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Qui a besoin d\'assurance? Tout le monde. Et ça nous tient occupés. Très occupés.

Chez Intact Lab, nous transformons l’expérience client de millions de Canadiens avec l’apprentissage machine, la science des données, le génie logiciel, l’IA, l’agilité, l’expérience utilisateur et la conception créative.

Simplifier l\'assurance demande empathie, créativité et détermination. On explore, on prend des risques, on se trompe, et on apprend, tout le temps.

Chez nous, l’innovation, c’est l’affaire de tous. Prêt à laisser votre marque?

Au Lab Intact, nous travaillons à entraîner des modèles d’apprentissage machine basés entre autres sur des approches d’apprentissage supervisé. Ce type d’approche requiert un grand nombre de données annotées que l’on utilise pour bâtir des jeux de données d’entraînement et de validation.

Afin de nous assurer que nos modèles sont aussi performants que nous le visons, l’Annotateur est responsable de repérer, d’étiqueter et de catégoriser le plus fidèlement possible un grand nombre de données provenant de jeux de données textes, audio et images tels que des transcriptions de conversations téléphoniques, des clavardages, des notes de réclamations, des photos de dommage sur des véhicules et bien d’autres.

En tant qu’Annotateur, votre excellent travail servira notamment aux scientifiques de données du Lab qui veulent évaluer des modèles d’apprentissage machine existants et entraîner de nouveaux modèles.

Relevant du gestionnaire d’une équipe affectée à la mise en place et à la structuration de certaines initiatives du Lab, vous travaillerez conjointement avec nos autres annotateurs et vous serez formé à utiliser des consignes précises afin de bien annoter les données au bénéfice de différentes équipes de l’Intact Lab – Science de données.

Responsabilités principales :

  • Annoter différents jeux de données à partir des consignes fournies.
  • Être une personne-ressource pour les questions touchant à l’annotation, à la linguistique ainsi qu’aux langues française et anglaise
  • Collaborer avec les équipes de l’Intact Lab – Science de Données dans la définition et le traitement de leurs besoins en annotation de données  

Capacités :

  • Faire preuve d’attention aux détails et de cohérence
  • Faire preuve de précision, d’un bon sens de l’observation et d’une grande rigueur
  • Rester concentré sur une longue période
  • Être dédié à la tâche
  • Savoir s’adapter au changement et faire face à l’ambiguïté
  • Avoir un esprit orienté vers la technologie
  • Avoir une excellente maîtrise du français et de l’anglais, parlés et écrits
  • Maîtriser les concepts de la linguistique appliquée
  • Avoir une excellente saisie au clavier
  • Faire preuve d’un grand professionnalisme: ponctualité, autonomie, etc.

Exigences

  • Formation académique (baccalauréat) en traduction, linguistique ou autre discipline langagière (atout)
  • Expérience en traduction, révision ou autres activités langagières (atout)

Voici quelques-uns des avantages qui amènent les gens à travailler chez nous :

  • Un milieu de travail inspirant et maintes fois primé qui soutient ses employés et reconnaît l’excellent travail accompli 
  • Des projets stimulants et ambitieux et des occasions de perfectionnement qui vous aideront à développer vos compétences et à faire progresser votre carrière.
  • La flexibilité de choisir où et comment vous travaillez.
  • Un régime complet d’avantages financiers qui reconnaît vos succès.
  • Une vaste gamme d’avantages sociaux flexibles.
  • Un régime d’achat d’actions des employés parmi les meilleurs de l’industrie, avec une cotisation de contrepartie correspondant à 50 % des actions nettes achetées.
  • Un code vestimentaire souple qui vous encourage à être vous-même.
  • Un compte de dépenses mieux-être prévoyant un montant annuel de base de 350 $ pour favoriser un mode de vie actif.

Égalité d’accès à l’emploi

Si nous pouvons rendre le processus de recrutement plus accessible pour vous, n’hésitez pas à nous dire quand nous pourrons vous faire part d’une possibilité d’emploi. Nous travaillerons avec vous pour répondre à vos besoins.

Cliquer ici pour d’autres informations importantes sur le processus d’embauche, y compris la vérification des antécédents, les candidats internes et le droit de travailler au Canada.

item.title: Gestionnaire de projet TI, Intact Lab
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Qui a besoin d\'assurance? Tout le monde. Et ça nous tient occupés. Très occupés.

Chez Intact Lab, nous transformons l’expérience client de millions de Canadiens avec l’apprentissage machine, la science des données, le génie logiciel, l’IA, l’agilité, l’expérience utilisateur et la conception créative. 

Simplifier l\'assurance demande empathie, créativité et détermination. On explore, on prend des risques, on se trompe, et on apprend, tout le temps.

Chez nous, l’innovation, c’est l’affaire de tous. Prêt à laisser votre marque?

Vous êtes d’avis que le développement de produits est comme un sport d’équipe? Vous aimez le travail d’équipe et considérer qu’ensemble nous sommes en mesure de réaliser de plus belles choses qu’individuellement? Vous êtes en mesure d’aller chercher la collaboration de tous pour réaliser nos objectifs d’entreprise? Vous êtes quelqu’un de motivateur et êtes un « servant leader » où le l’accomplissement d’un projet est plus important que l’accomplissement individuel? Vous avez une grande capacité d’écoute et êtes toujours prêt à ajuster le processus aux gens et au produit auxquels il est destiné? Parfait! Vous êtes la personne que nous cherchons!

Nous cherchons un Gestionnaire de projets TI pour notre équipe grandissante!

Ce que vous accomplirez chez nous :

  • Garder une orientation d\'affaires constante et une compréhension de l\'orientation stratégique actuelle des technologies d\'Intact.
  • Maîtriser le « Business Case » tout en développant une compréhension du domaine d’affaires.
  • Gérer les projets en comprenant les stratégies, les priorités et les enjeux de la compagnie.
  • Évaluer les capacités pour pouvoir proposer des solutions appropriées et pour livrer les valeurs de la compagnie.
  • Gérer les parties prenantes et maintenir de bonnes relations avec les collaborateurs internes et externes.
  • Définir le mandat d\'un programme de même que son envergure en collaboration avec les parrains du programme / projet.
  • Entreprendre les activités pour commencer les projets et établir une vision de l\'envergure avec le parrain.
  • Diviser le projet en tâches réalisable et établir un organigramme fonctionnel avec les rôles et les responsabilités.
  • Développer et maintenir à jour les plans intégrés du projet en identifiant les livrables et les dépendances, en estimant la durée et les coûts qui y sont associés et en participant à l\'assignation des ressources humaines aux sous-activités.
  • Apporter les conseils opportuns aux experts et aux parrains tout au long du projet afin d\'atteindre et de respecter les objectifs.
  • Assurer que l\'investissement dans le projet offre les meilleurs livrables/produits ou valeur optimale au client/parrain.
  • Construire, diriger et coordonner, en mode de supervision directe et/ou indirecte, les activités d\'une équipe multidisciplinaire incluant des gestionnaires de projets (PM) et contrôleurs de projet (PCO).
  • Rédiger des rapports sur l\'ensemble du projet (progrès, problèmes, coûts, fermeture, etc.) tout en respectant les indicateurs de performance établie.
  • Diriger la gestion des risques du projet.
  • Gérer efficacement la livraison des projets.
  • Maintenir les tableaux de bord de façon périodique et progressive tout au long du programme/projets.
  • Anticiper les problèmes et les situations difficiles et prendre les mesures nécessaires pour les résoudre.
  • Assurer une communication proactive et efficace à tous les niveaux du projet.
  • Assurer la mise en place des bons canaux de communications entre les collaborateurs au projet.
  • Gérer les relations avec le client, la haute direction et les chefs de projet principaux (le cas échéant) et répondre à leurs attentes.
  • Apporter du leadership et de la vision au projet.
  • Officialiser les procédés et le contrôle de la qualité.
  • Apporter son aide quant aux pratiques de gestion de projet d\'Intact et assister à leur développement.


Ce que vous mettrez à profit :

  • Baccalauréat en administration des affaires ou toute combinaison de formation et d\'expérience équivalente.
  • Certification PMP (un atout).
  • Au moins 8 à 10 années d’expérience pertinente.
  • Minimum de 3 ans en gestion de projets.
  • Expérience en livraison de projet en mode Agile.
  • Expérience en négociation de contrat avec le secteur d’approvisionnement.
  • Expérience de gestion de projets faisant partie d’un programme.
  • Expérience de travail avec des outils de gestion de projets (Clarity, MS Project, autres).
  • Expérience de travail dans un environnement virtuel.
  • Expérience en gestion matricielle des ressources.
  • Nécessité d’interagir sur une base régulière avec des collègues partout au pays 

#LI-IT #LI-Hybrid #IN-QC

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.
 

If you are an employee of Intact, belairdirect, or Johnson Insurance, please apply for this role on Contact People.

item.title: UX Designer
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

About us

How do you imagine life at an insurance company - its people, its culture, its offices? We bet that if you swing by Intact Lab, you\'ll be in for quite the surprise! With offices in downtown Toronto and Montreal, the Lab is a digital innovation hub tasked with creating cutting-edge insurtech products that improve the lives of millions of Canadians.

The Lab merges the best of two worlds: the speed and culture of a start-up, with the resources and means of a large enterprise (you\'ll have access to all the tools you\'ve ever dreamed of!). With a dynamic team, exciting challenges, beautiful offices, inspiring colleagues and a great work culture (we rank as one of Canada\'s top 100 places to work), Intact Lab offers an amazing environment to develop your skills and grow your career.

About you

Are you passionate about digital innovation and Mobile experiences? Are you skilled at translating complex requirements into usable and delightful experiences? Do you keep on top of the latest trends in design and love experimenting with new tools and methodologies? We\'ve got the perfect opportunity for you!

Your role

As a UX Designer, you play a mission critical role in conceiving and evolving our digital experience. Reporting to the Manager Design, Mobile Apps, your main responsibilities are:

  • Crafting human-centered experiences that help achieve business objectives.
  • Giving a voice to our customers by leveraging user-centric design practices.
  • Translate user needs and business requirements into engaging mobile features and functionality.
  • Assess and optimize feature performance with customers, analytics, and design research.
  • Work across cross-functional teams to design customer experiences and internal processes.
  • Create all assets to effectively conceptualize, communicate, and deliver the user-experience.


Qualifications

  • At least 3 years of experience as a UX Designer or Lead UX Designer.
  • Strong capabilities in usability testing and user-centered design practices.
  • Capacity to understand business needs and to translate them into design requirements.
  • Mastery of design tools, especially Figma.
  • Experience with UX research tools an asset (usertesting.com, Optimal Workshop, etc.).
  • Experience in producing customer journey maps, process flows, content inventories, etc.
  • You love working in a collaborative environment that has a strong focus on teamwork, innovation, open minds and having fun.

Please include your portfolio in your application.

You are

  • Creative, analytical, curious and ingenious.
  • A team player that can share and receive constructive feedback.
  • You excel at explaining your ideas to different stakeholders.
  • Deeply passionate about design and quality.
  • Organized, fully autonomous and proactive.

As a full-time employee your benefits include

  • A competitive salary.
  • An annual performance bonus.
  • A pension plan.
  • Flexible work hours and a 35 hour work week.
  • Top of the line medical and dental insurance.
  • A new MacBook Pro.
  • And many more benefits (gym refunds, paid conferences, etc.).

What we offer

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • A financial rewards program that recognizes your success

  • An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan; we match 50% of net shares purchased

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.

item.title: Lead QA Engineer Developer, AI projects, Hong Kong AI
item.description:
Who needs insurance? Everybody. That keeps us busy. Very busy. At the Intact Lab, we use machine learning, data science, software engineering, AI, agility, UX and design thinking to transform the customer experience for millions of Canadians. Simplifying insurance takes creativity, empathy and hard work. We explore, take risks, make mistakes, and learn all day, every day. Here, innovation is everyone\'s job. Ready to make your mark?

About the role

Our Intact Lab in Hong Kong is looking for an experienced Lead QA Engineer to join the AI Engineering team.

Intact Lab, Hong Kong location: Building 19W, 19 Science Park West Avenue, Hong Kong Science Park

Artificial intelligence is shaping the future of insurance. Our latest lab is located in the Hong Kong Science and Technology Park to turn this vision into a reality. As Canada\'s largest home, auto and business insurer, we\'re here to cultivate the next generation of technology and talent. Together, we\'re helping our customers protect what matters to them most through the power of data science, machine learning and AI.

About the role

As a tech pioneer in a new AI lab, you’ll have the opportunity to:

  • Contribute to high performing and scalable data analytics pipeline for real-life customer and business issues

  • Influence the AI roadmap for the largest home, auto business insurer in Canada

  • Explore and master new technologies to use them in your own solutions

  • Grow alongside a diverse team of world-class experts in data science, software engineering, actuarial science, business and design

  • Mentor and coach interns and other developers to help us grow, as a team

All this plus great work-life balance, ergonomic office set-up, and our coffee & snack corner!

Here’s what you bring to the table:

  • A bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, AI or a related discipline

  • 4/5+ years of experience in test automation (backend)

  • Proficiency in Python is a must

  • Experience with Flask, PyTest is preferred

  • Unlimited curiosity and a passion to challenge the status quo

  • Ability to transform vaguely defined issues into a testing environment

  • A good communicator (oral and written) in English

  • Great teamwork and ability to coach others

Some nice-to-have

  • Software testing in the context of AI application

  • Experience with MongoDB, Kafka, AWS

  • Knowledge of DevOps modern tools

Life in the Lab

Technology is only as good as the people behind it. Every day at work, you’ll inspire and be inspired by the brilliant minds of our greater lab team: actuaries, data scientists, machine learning experts, geomathematicians, meteorologists, software engineers and designers.

Together, you will tackle challenging problems and have the freedom to imagine, research, create, test, and bring innovative solutions to life that will have a profound impact on our business and the needs of our customers.

As our company grows, your career will grow with it.  There will always be an opportunity for you to develop your leadership skills, strengthen your expertise or take your work in a new direction.  Whether it’s leading a new, exciting project or moving into a different A.I. product team in Canada or Hong Kong, your career will always be on the move.

About Us

The Intact Lab – with headquarters in Montreal, Canada – is a fast-growing, digital innovation hub backed by Intact Financial Corporation (TSX: IFC, HK$110 billion in market cap), Canada’s largest home, auto and business insurance company. 

Intact Financial (HK) limited (Intact Lab, HK) is our first R&D A.I. centre outside of Canada. This expansion into the Asia Pacific region is an exciting chapter of our journey to become the best insurance A.I. shop in the world.

#LI-IT #LI-Hybrid

Working here means you\'ll be empowered to be and do your best every day. Here is some of what you can expect as a permanent member of our team:

  • An extensive flex pension and benefits package, with access to virtual healthcare

  • Flexible work arrangements

  • Possibility to purchase up to 5 extra days off per year

  • An annual wellness account that promotes an active and healthy lifestyle

  • Access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues

  • A dynamic workplace learning ecosystem complete with learning journeys, interactive online content, and inspiring programs

  • Inclusive employee-led networks to educate, inspire, amplify voices, build relationships and provide development opportunities

  • Inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow

  • A Community Impact program, because what you care about is a part of what makes you different. And how you contribute to your community should be just as unique

We are an equal opportunity employer

At Intact, we value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected, and heard.

item.title: Assistant Manager – Data Analytics
item.description:
At CN, everyday brings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environment where you’re part of making sure our business is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We provide the kind of paid training and opportunities that long-term careers are built on and we recognize hard workers who strive to make a difference. You will be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Assistant Manager Data Analytics is responsible for analyzing, reporting, and measuring Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) on the operational services, including rail, terminal, and truck by mining critical data and driving fact-based recommendations to Intermodal leadership team. The position works within the Customer Service team and contributes to CN’s Intermodal International and Automotive by combining in-depth functional knowledge of rail, truck, terminal operations, and customer commitments with expertise in data analysis and reporting.

Main Responsibilities

Analysis

·       Control and analyze large sums of data across various CN platforms to improve quality and access to critical information on the network

·       Source, evaluate and analyze data from both commercial and operational points of view to provide detailed information for decision makers and stakeholders in both functions

·       Contribute to building customer score cards that provide qualitative and historical view of CN’s performance

·       Utilize multiple internal cross-functional data sources to consolidate data and make recommendations pertaining to service improvements

·       Support the development and implementation of tools and processes that assist in Customer Service reporting and automation

·       Perform data analysis that provide direction on strategic decisions concerning train, terminal, and truck performance

·       Design and develop reporting solutions to drive business decision-making

·       Collaborate with end users to deliver self-serve analytical tools that increase user autonomy and eliminate redundant data mining

·       Map business processes and identify areas for automation and improvement

·       Cooperate with Analysts to drive adoption of modern tools including Tableau and Power BI

·       Define measures, KPIs, and build comprehensive dashboards

Equipment Planning 

·       Support daily execution of the Empty Movement Directive plan, delay in the network, develop, and manage empty pipeline report

·       Adjust and communicate with Marketing and Operations stakeholders

·       Leverage data to identify gaps and propose solutions to resolve short- and long-term challenges

Stakeholder Engagement 

·       Engage stakeholders and participate in meetings and sessions to understand team\'s impact on each stakeholder’s metrics

·       Focus on bridging gaps between Sales, Service, and Intermodal Operations

·       Manage and maintain relationships, communication and collaboration with internal customers

·       Analyze, clarify, and prioritize Intermodal project requirements for Customer Service

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a combination of regular workweek and weekends when necessary. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress. The role requires minimal travel (5%).

Requirements

Experience

Data Analysis

·       Between 3 to 5 years of data analysis experience

o   Experience working with large volumes of data

o   Experience working with Systems, Applications and Products (SAP), Software

o   Experience in Requirements Specifications of Service Reliability System (SRS) and SAP Business Objects

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, and Business Administration

Competencies

·       Develops solutions that align with customers’ expectations to increase satisfaction

·       Shares timely information within and across functions to get things done effectively

·       Applies analytical thinking to make recommendations that pursue sustainable performance

·       Is agile in responding to the rapid evolution of the industry and of technology

·       Deals with pressure and change by staying calm to quickly adapt to changes

·       Continuously innovates to create value, without compromising on safety and quality

·       Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

·       Influences by translating expertise into practical business outcomes

·       Fluently bilingual both written and verbal (English, French)*

*Any skills/attributes for these above would be considered as an asset

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Knowledge of Tableau and Power BI

·       Knowledge of Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) as well as Business to Business (B2B) information flows and processes

·       Knowledge of Transportation, Intermodal Operations, Logistics, and Supply Chain systems

·       Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)

·       Knowledge of various databases such as Database 2 (Db2), Netezza, and Oracle*

·       Knowledge of transportation industry and KPIs*

 

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

About CN

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance contributes to the SAP ecosystem roadmap by planning, executing and providing expertise on data-related activities.  The role is instrumental as CN is currently undertaking a large multi-year business transformation program triggered by a SAP ECC to a SAP S/4 HANA product migration.

 

The incumbent works within a multi-disciplinary team and participates in a variety of data activities, namely: profiling, quality assessment and cleansing of master and transactional data objects, including establishment of data cleansing strategies and their implementation;  master data mapping, transformation and enrichment, to account for new SAP product data models and business transformation  requirements; and data governance and management tasks on approval workflows, configurations and processes to ensure data objects maintain compliance to CN quality standards throughout their lifecycle.

 

The incumbent contributes to data validation runs, troubleshooting, data reconciliation and identification of corrective actions prior to production migrations.

The position helps develop skills and experience in setting up and managing best-in-class data pipelines that are becoming essential building block in industries adopting data-centric digital transformation approaches.

 

Main Responsibilities

Data Profiling and Cleansing – Data-Related Tasks on the “As-Is” Environment – 30%

Participates in data objects identification and business  rules profiling

Performs data  quality  assessment and quality  metrics reporting

Participates in manual/automated data object cleansing strategies and their implementation

Collaborates to the iterative post-cleansing validation and implementation of corrective measures

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools to carry out tasks

 

Data Mapping and Transformation - Data-Related Tasks on the “To-Be” Environment – 40%

Participates in identification and design of functional data mapping, transformation and enrichment activities and documentation according to the business process re-engineering efforts and new S/4 HANA data structures

Implements sandbox solutions to assess data mapping and transformation methods, including algorithms

Performs iterative validation runs and implement corrective measures on conversions

Leverages off-the-shelf and specialized tools and conversion platforms to carry out tasks

 

Data Governance and Management - Data-Related Tasks on the Data Lifecycle and Enhancements – 30%

Identifies, implements, and validates governance workflow and data business rules requirements for master data management, in conjunction with business owners

Takes part in data quality assessment on target systems

Implements data governance roadmap and strategy on specialized data management tools and platforms

Participates in functional designs and documentation, system configuration, and validation

Maps enterprise-level data governance requirements into SAP landscape

 

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure, and stress.

 

Requirements

Experience

Managing and Handling Enterprise Data

Between 1 to 3 years of experience in managing and handling enterprise data

Education/Certification/Designation

Bachelor’s Degree in a technical or business field, with an interest in data management

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science or  Engineering*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

 

Competencies

Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

Applies analytical thinking

Innovates through problem solving

Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

Demonstrates organizational abilities

Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

Works independently with little supervision

 

Technical Skills/Knowledge

Strong interest in managing and validating data, understanding its attributes, characteristics and business value.

Hands-on experience in planning and executing general Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) data tasks*

Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, in particular SAP (SAP ECC, SAP S/4 HANA)*

Strong interest in business processes and the way data interrelates to those processes

Interest in exploring data, performing investigation and analysis, and applying resolution and validation in complex data sets

Knowledge of Excel or equivalent productivity tools

Ability and interest in developing advanced user knowledge of specialized data management platforms and tools such as Syniti Advanced Data Migration (ADM), SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), SAP Utopia, SAP Asset Information Workbench (AIW)

Ability to present and communicate results clearly

Knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL) statements and scripting, including SQL Server Management Studio*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

 

Organizational Impact

Decision Making & Impacts

The position performs data-centric tasks that are foundational to the SAP ecosystem roadmap and lifecycle

 

Level of Interaction/Influence

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance interacts with business and Information and Technology (I&T) data experts, Coordinators, Data Technology Specialists, Solution Architects, enterprise-level data governance teams, as well as working closely with their business and functional counterparts in Finance, Procurement, Supply Management, Mechanical and Engineering organizations. 

Employees Supervised/Organizational Structure

The Analyst, SAP Data Conversion and Governance reports to the Senior Manager, SAP S/4 HANA Transformation, Data Governance and Migration, Information and Technology. The role has no supervisory responsibilities.

 

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

 

CN requires that all employees in Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. The Company’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly owned subsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers and anyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

item.title: Specialist Project management
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

Are you passionate about finding better ways to do things? Can you spot potential problems a mile away? Do you want to be part of CN’s strategy in redefining the railroad through I&T transformation?  If yes, then we may have the role for you!

As a Project Portfolio Specialist, you will drive central planning, dependency management and executive reporting. You will be working across the Office of the CITO and I&T. Working with various teams, you will produce the overall transformation plan including outcomes, milestones, and dependencies. This will provide transparency of progress and help us to make sure we deliver amazing propositions for colleagues and business partners. 

 

Depending on the team, most of our roles offer flexible working and you will work remotely temporarily due to COVID-19.

 

Main Responsibilities

Reporting into the Office of the CITO, the PPO Specialist will be responsible for supporting the organization\'s PPO team, helping to ensure that projects stay on track by tracking the status of transformation deliverables, milestones, and financials.

Project Governance

 ·         Assist with the assessment and analysis of proposed project investments 

 ·         Review Project Change Requests.

 ·         As part of a team understand the detail of projects and provide governance advice to project teams.

 ·         Support project teams in project financial, risk and issue management as directed.

 ·         Monitor the portfolio to ensure compliance to Project Delivery Life Cycle (PDLC- CN Operating Model).

 ·         Review project closeout documentation for accuracy and completion.

 ·         Maintain repository and act as custodian of PPO policies, standards, artifacts, and procedures.

 ·         Support the implementation and maintenance of the PPO quality strategy.

 ·         Support Project Managers where necessary in project initiation, planning, execution, or control.

 ·         Assist in strategic and budgetary planning processes (as needed).

 

Benefits Realization

  •  Support the review of benefits and provide advice to enhance the quality of the benefits
  •  Work with business units to ensure the tracking of project benefits.
  • Collect and analyze data on benefits realization.

 

Portfolio Management

  • Support the production of pipeline data analysis across dependencies, key resource needs, priorities, and benefits.
  • Support project quality management planning, project health checks and lessons learned
  • Work across the portfolio to monitor the delivery of project outcomes.
  • Support the portfolio and project management tools to ensure accurate, relevant, and up-to-date information.
  • Develop Management Reports to provide stakeholders with transparency on the progress and health of projects and the portfolio.
  • Manage project intake process along with any incoming engagement needs.

Continuous Improvement

  • Lead ad hoc studies and investigations.
  • Provide project management guidance to other members of the team.

 

  Project Management Methodology

  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of Operating processes, templates, and systems.
  • Support the Office of the CITO communication and change activities to ensure all stakeholders are informed of the latest PPO processes.
  • Provide introduction, briefing and uplift sessions on governance and project management related processes.
  • Responsible for collecting and consolidating transformation data from a variety of sources for analytics (time, scope, change, budget, benefits, risk, quality) and to produce regular reports and presentations for all levels of governance and key stakeholders.
  • Develop PPO processes and provide training, coaching, oversight, and continuous improvement.
  • Managing the integrated transformation roadmap and associated financials.

Skills

Problem Solving and Judgment: Uses sound judgment and flexibility when recommending appropriate options and solutions; taking a broad scale, long-term view, assessing options and implications; committed to a course of action to accomplish a long-range goal or vision; guides others toward making effective decisions.

Results Orientation: Maintaining operational effectiveness in an environment that contains ambiguity and uncertainty; develops plans and strategies that are ambitious but realistic; and achieves results through others in a positive fashion that balances the interest of CN I&T.

Interpersonal Relationships: Possesses tremendous honesty and integrity; displays strong sense of character and humility; engages in creative approaches to managing team dynamics; values others, focusing on individual uniqueness and preserving an individual’s dignity.

Teamwork: Believing in, supporting, and championing project team members, focuses on creating an environment that strives to meet the voice of the team through the ability to empathize, understand, build rapport, show concern, encourage, engage and connecting with team members; uses sound ethical practices in carrying out operational duties.

Leadership/motivational: Maintains a sense of the big picture and the ability to communicate and mobilize people around a shared vision; engages in a leadership style that is appropriate to the project, person, task, and situation; involving others.

Analysis: Makes credible recommendation based on reports and statistics and ensures that decisions are implemented; reviews decisions considering changed circumstances.

Project Management: Establishes priorities, tasks, and work schedules in advance, maximizes the use of available resources; describes milestones in terms of what is achieved and delivered; allocates decision making authority and task responsibilities to appropriate team members; monitors the progress of plans and ensures that action is taken to resolve delays; anticipates and promptly raises operational or resource issues.

Change Management: Maintains a sense of pace and urgency in self so that change initiatives do not stagnate.

Resilience/assertiveness: Effectively deals with work related problems, pressure, and stress in a professional and positive manner; recovers quickly when faced with obstacles or setbacks.

Communication: Possesses the ability to listen, read body language, ask questions, provide feedback, and generate two-way communication to build trust; engage in a variety of communication styles to articulate goals and objectives; providing timely and relevant information that allows team members to fully participate; effectively deliver information to an audience in a formal setting.

Flexibility: To deliver services effectively, a degree of flexibility is required. The successful candidate may be required to perform work not specifically referred to above.

 

Requirements

Education/Certification/Designation

·       College in technical degree (IT related field)

·       PMI certification (or within 2 years of obtaining OR interest to obtain)

Skills/Knowledge

·       Advanced knowledge of tools and techniques (MS-Project, Excel, PPM tools (Project Portfolio Management tools))

·       Good understanding of project financial management

Experience

·  More than 3 to 5 years as an IT PM, leading small to medium size projects (<1M$)

-  Strong analytical skills, with detail oriented and problem solving mindset;

- Support project financials and participate in monthly project forecasting exercise;

- Track project forecasting accuracy and produce review reports on a monthly/quarterly basis;

- Working with Finance and PCOs for month-end activities, including accruals, GR’s, Journal Entries and reconciliation tasks;

- Exercise and follow project financial governance process and ensure the data integrity of all systems (SAP, MSP, Apptio), and investigate when discrepancies arise;

- Ad-hoc financial analysis reports to support decision making in project management;

- Assist in streamlining of Capex and Opex budget;

- Assist in project budget approval process;

- Assist in audit related tasks;

- Knowledge of MS Project planning tool will be an asset;

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

item.title: Intern, International Intermodal Market Analyst
item.description:
At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us! 

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern, International Intermodal Market Analyst position in Toronto, Ontario for summer 2023 (May – August).

Job Summary

The Intern, International Intermodal Market Analyst is responsible for developing a deep understanding of CN’s customer needs within the organization’s competitive environment through market research and data analytics to support the International Intermodal Marketing team in expanding our market share. The role represents an opportunity to learn about the International Intermodal business and gain insights into CN’s Consumer Products Supply Chain as goods move across North America from production to final delivery. Moreover, the incumbent will gain an understanding of pricing, contract management, revenue tracking, and creating supply chain solutions as they relate to intermodal transportation.

Major Responsibilities

  • Administer specific pricing and marketing activities, including contract and price application
  • Generate reports and collaborate in analysis
  • Assess market and modal competition, costs, service requirements and equipment availability
  • Undertake research related to corridor pricing structure and modal competition
  • Perform market research including competitive market data

Requirements

  • Ability to translate market information and trends into business decisions
  • Ability to identify key issues that affect CN\'s competitive position
  • Initiative, sound judgment, and accountability
  • Excellent analytical, interpersonal, and communication skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
  • Ability to prioritize in an efficient manner

Education

  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, or equivalent field

About CN  

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. item.title: Expert Data Engineering
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

The Expert Data Engineering is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers, shaping the enterprise Data as a Service (DaaS) model and delivering on IT business models. The Expert Data Engineering develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap.

Main Responsibilities

Data Engineering 

·       Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects

·       Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives

·       Build, manage, and optimize data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers such as business or data analysts and data scientists

·       Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines

·       Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines

·       Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives

·       Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes

·       Promote effective data management practices

Data Design 

·       Collaborate with stakeholders and architects to model data landscape and define secure data exchange approaches

·       Meet with stakeholders to identify fit-for-purpose within CN’s existing data ecosystem and deliver options and agile solutions

·       Design and develop processing pipelines that ingest data into Data Hubs

·       Expose the data into meaningful formats, like GraphQL

·       Provide day-to-day support and technical expertise to both technical and non-technical teams

·       Participate in building data engineering expertise and framework

·       Translate business needs into technical requirements

Data Development 

·       Acquire, ingest and process data from multiple sources and systems

·       Design and develop Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) pipelines using multiple sources of data in various formats

·       Conduct metadata management, data cleansing and preparation

·       Produce well documented quality codes

Data Operations - 10%

·       Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget

·       Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines

·       Help unify software development and operations seamlessly, efficiently, and cost effectively

·       Improve software quality, automate processes, and accelerate software releases

Data Quality Assurance 

·       Use Agile development practices for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines

·       Develop and implement test plans and scripts for various data quality processes

·       Maintain manual and automated test scripts

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday and offers remote work.

 

Requirements

Experience

Data Engineering

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in a data engineering role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality

·       Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative

·       Experience with at least 2 of the following technologies: Python, Scala, SQL, Java

·       Experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, etc.

·       Experience with Cloud and non-Cloud based Hadoop ecosystem

·       Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks

·       Experience with traditional data warehousing and ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, Pentaho, DataStage)

·       Experience with Linux and shell scripting

·       Experience deploying applications into production environments such as code packaging, integration testing, monitoring and release management

·       Experience with multiple database technologies such as Distributed Processing (Spark, Hadoop, EMR), traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, PostgreSQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, Cassandra)

·       Experience working in an Agile team environment

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Software Engineering

·       Master’s Degree or PhD in Data Management, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related quantitative field*

·       Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) Degree*

·       Google or Azure Data Engineering certification*

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience through speech and writing

·       Ability to communicate complex solutions

·       Applies analytical thinking

·       Innovates through problem solving

·       Knows the business and stays current with industry trends to elevate expertise and work

·       Demonstrates organizational abilities and detail oriented

·       Collaborates with key internal stakeholders to enable higher productivity

·       Works independently with little supervision

·       Applies agile mindset

·       Ability to work across structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, extracting information and identifying linkages across disparate data sets

·       Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Strong data analytics and development skills

·       Demonstrated creativity skills

·       Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python

·       Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Kafka, etc.

·       Expertise with one or more SQL-on-Hadoop technology (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

·       Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability

·       Expertise with GraphQL*

*Any knowledge for any of the above would be considered as an asset

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year.
