item.title: Senior Manager Cloud Security & DevSecOps Architecture
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

[The purpose of this role is to establish a Cloud security and DevSecOps practice, develop & mentor a team, and define cybersecurity reference architectures and standards for all Cloud environments at CN, and define processes for ensuring security through DevOps activities.

Main Responsibilities

Leading Others

  • Partner with HR to bring new talent to the organization by determining which skills and roles will be required in the future and by making thoughtful hiring decisions
  • Provide a positive and welcoming onboarding experience to all new employees by ensuring they have access to the tools and resources needed to fulfill the requirements of their job
  • Recognize employee milestones (service awards, retirements, etc.) as well as significant contributions and enhanced responsibilities
  • Focus on communications and foster collaboration by regularly providing updates to teams about ongoing initiatives and encouraging teams to work together to accomplish common goals and learning
  • Manage employee performance by ensuring employees who are not meeting expectations are identified and supported through the performance improvement process
  • Create and enable a positive and engaging work environment by ensuring individual strengths are uncovered and leveraged through frequent and focused conversations - collaborate, coach and build connections with employees
  • Participate in succession planning by contributing to the yearly talent review cycle and identifying employees with the potential to move up the management and expertise paths
  • Support employee development by having regular career conversations with all employees (documented and tracked) and supporting them in reaching their career goals
  • Ensure knowledge is preserved through cross-training for key skill sets in the team (knowledge transfer)

Cloud Security & DevSecOps Architecture Practice Development

  • Direct and put in place the proper sets of cloud security architecture controls to manage safety and security risk while enabling the business for technology systems such as: service-oriented-architectures; cloud technologies and containers; advanced analytics; AI; Industrial IoT;, networking infrastructure; mobile technologies; etc.
  • Ensure the cloud security architecture is maintainable, sustainable and properly documented
  • Maintain and build relevant, current, valid and reliable team knowledge related to cloud security architecture to leverage existing cybersecurity infrastructure and process, where appropriate, and drive configuration standards while supporting digital transformation in the I&T environment
  • Drive key decisions involving cloud architecture and technologies
  • Advance security team accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members
  • Ensure the full documentation of security designs, as built architectures and operational processes through clear diagrams and well-written documents

Cloud Security Roadmap and Strategy

  • Collaborate with the CISO, cybersecurity team, portfolio managers, other architects, and I&T leadership to understand the business direction and consequent impact on the security posture
  • Define the proper course of action and investment strategy by building business cases and security roadmaps
  • Engage the cloud vendor ecosystem to understand capabilities and limitations to drive improvements in the security posture of current products, and assist in the selection of the right partners
  • Engage the cybersecurity vendor ecosystem to understand capabilities, options for compensating controls and risk mitigations to facilitate the selection of partners that integrate with the overall architecture
  • Continuously monitor and evaluate the environment through self-assessments and independent security reviews. Enable management to identify deficiencies and inefficiencies and to initiate improvement actions though security roadmap and strategies

Working Conditions

Occasional business travel (Canada and US) in accordance with CN policy

Requirements

Experience

  • Minimum 15 years overall IT experience, preferably in software development
  • Minimum 10 years experience in software development security
  • Minimum 5 years experience in cloud security architecture
  • Multi-cloud experience including AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud Platform (asset)
  • Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies (asset)
  • Experience in securing RPA functions and leveraging RPA for security tasks (asset)
  • Experience supervising and mentoring others is highly preferred (asset)
  • Railroad, transportation, or Global industrial experience is a significant plus (asset)

Education/Certification/Designation

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, System Analysis or other relevant field
  • Master’s degree in related field preferred
  • At least one recognized Cloud security certification: e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK), Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP), GIAC Cloud Security Automation (GCSA) etc.
  • Architecture related certifications (TOGAF, Zachman, CISSP-ISSAP, etc.) preferred

Competencies

  • Ability to define and organise an architecture security apparatus in reusable building blocks: patterns, services, components, capability models, etc.
  • Demonstrated capability to understand the security implications of complex business operations and how they are linked to technological solutions that provide practical risk mitigation and business enablement
  • Significant and proven experience in applying a structured approach to problem resolution in large, geographically dispersed organizations with 24/7 operations
  • Ability to derive security requirements from vaguely formulated business needs
  • Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as business acumen
  • Detail-oriented self-starter with a high level of commitment and personal motivation
  • Knack for prioritizing tasks and working in a fast-paced environment

Technical Skills/Knowledge

  • Expert knowledge of the processes, methodologies, tools and techniques, used for building large information technology systems in private and public clouds
  • Knowledge of standards, regulations and legislation governing Information Security, e.g. NIST, ISO 27001, OWASP
  • Knowledge of general IT security architecture and technologies including: service-oriented-architectures, mobile technologies including Mobile Device Management (MDM), data-centric design, advanced analytics, AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) lifecycles, Digital Forensics, End Point Encryption, Encryption Key Management, Database Security, Enterprise Directory Services, IDS, IPS, Next Generation Firewall, Application Firewall, Enterprise Password Vaults , Cloud SaaS /PaaS/IaaS Security, SIEM, etc. (asset)
  • In depth understanding of securing APIs (asset)
  • Deep knowledge of container security, especially Kubernetes (asset)



Main Responsibilities

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. item.title: Terminal Coordinator Planner
item.description:
At CN, everyday brings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environment where you’re part of making sure our business is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We provide the kind of paid training and opportunities that long-term careers are built on and we recognize hard workers who strive to make a difference. You will be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

Job Summary

The Terminal Coordinator Planner is responsible for leading the operational planning process to handle supply, demand, and terminal capacity with a reliance on tools, data and technology to drive decision making. The incumbent handles the planning of work orders to drive productivity and throughput for trains turn around and servicing of customers. Moreover, the role is responsible for overseeing the daily fluidity of their respective terminal or territory. Terminal fluidity is driven primarily by prioritizing safety through policy implementation, consistent process management and effective use of all available assets. The position also ensures management of assets in a way that enables cost effective loading and unloading of Intermodal trains and efficient service to the trucking community that uses CN terminals and with a view toward improvement and optimization of standard operating procedures.

Main Responsibilities

Operational Management process and Planning

·       Plan containers inventory for the creation of work orders and monitor productivity of all resources in the yard to successfully unload inbound trains and fully load outbound trains for on-time departures

·       Ensure development of a plan for all aspects of Intermodal terminal operations (e.g., demand of containers, supply of resources, train loading plan) and review plans quality and work towards improving it

·       Plan for the Sequencing of Work Orders (WO) considering Zone assignment

·       Communicate with supervisor and actively monitor WO status to handle equipment assignment according to operating conditions in the yard

·       Optimize use of the ground and wheel storage areas and the planning of container inventory allocations

·       Use available data to handle carter volume and congestion in the yard and assign resources accordingly

·       Collaborate with other departments and supply functions to improve planning aspects

Safety and Compliance Management

·       Maintain a safe work environment and control daily safety requirements

·       Validate rule compliance including positive feedback for compliance and appropriate follow-up for non-compliance

·       Provide coaching and formal statements

Staff Management 

·       Onboard, coach and mentor all employees on process changes and operational requirements

Trucking Management

·       Ensure trucking community is receiving timely service to limit truck driver dwells in the terminal

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with shift work including overnight hours, weekends, and holidays. Due to the nature of the role, the incumbent must be able to meet tight deadlines, handle pressure and stress. The role requires minimal travel (up to 10%).

Requirements

Experience

Operations

·       Minimum 5 years of experience in an operation environment*

o   Experience leading a unionized environment*

o   Experience directing employees with safety sensitive or safety critical jobs

o   Experience in a 24/7 environment

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s Degree with specialization in Operations, Supply Chain, Engineering, or Business*

·       Valid Driver’s Licence

·       First Aid Certification

*Any designation for these above would be considered as an asset

Competencies

·       Leads by example for the safety and security of all

·       Considers ESG principles in all operations

·       Collaborates with others and shares information

·       Solves problems to create value

·       Demonstrates active listening

·       Sets direction and inspires others

·       Communicates with impact

·       Develops self and others

·       Applies critical thinking

·       Demonstrates agility and drives change

Technical Skills/Knowledge

·       Understanding of Safety Management principles

·       Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)

·       Knowledge of data analytics

·       Knowledge of business and management principles involved in operational planning, resource allocation, demand and supply, and process management

 

About CN

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

item.title: Expert OT Security Architecture
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

Job Summary

 The purpose of this role is to evaluate Operational Technology (OT) solutions, configurations, and designs against security requirements, and define cybersecurity reference architectures and standards for all OT environments at CN.

 

Main Responsibilities

 OT Security Architecture Practice 

·       Put in place the proper sets of OT security architecture controls to ensure authenticity, non-repudiation, and least privilege commensurate with risk requirements.

·       Ensure the OT security architecture is maintainable, sustainable and properly documented.

·       Maintain and build relevant, current, valid and reliable team knowledge related to OT and Security Architecture to leverage existing cybersecurity infrastructure and process, where appropriate, while supporting Transportation, Mechanical and Network Ops functions in enacting risk based security controls as part of a broader OT environment.

·       Facilitate key decisions involving OT architecture and technologies.

·       Advance security team accomplishments and competence by planning delivery of solutions; answering technical and procedural questions for less experienced team members; teaching improved processes; mentoring team members.

·       Ensure the full documentation of security designs, as built architectures and operational processes through clear diagrams and well-written documents.

 

OT Security Roadmap and Strategy 

·       Collaborate with the CISO, Sr Mgr OT Security Architecture, cybersecurity team, portfolio managers, other architects, and I&T leadership to understand the business direction and consequent impact on the security posture. 

·       Define the proper course of action and investment strategy by building business cases and security roadmaps.

·       Engage the OT vendor ecosystem to understand capabilities and limitations to drive improvements in the security posture of current products, and assist in the selection of the right partners.

·       Continuously monitor and evaluate the environment through self-assessments and independent security reviews. Enable management to identify deficiencies and inefficiencies and to initiate improvement actions though security roadmap and strategies.

Requirements

Education/Certification/Designation

·       Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, System Analysis or other relevant field

·       At least one recognized security certification: e.g. Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Global Industrial Cyber Security Professional (GICSP), ISA/IEC 62443 Cybersecurity Expert, etc.

·       Architecture related certifications (TOGAF, Zachman, CISSP-ISSAP, etc.) preferred


Skills/Knowledge

·       Ability to define and organise an architecture security apparatus in reusable building blocks: patterns, services, components, capability models, etc;

·       Demonstrated capability to understand the security implications of complex business operations and how they are linked to technological solutions that provide practical risk mitigation and business enablement;

·       Strong knowledge of the processes, methodologies, tools and techniques, used for building large information technology systems;

·       Proven experience in applying a structured approach to problem resolution in large, geographically dispersed organizations with 24/7 operations;

·       Strong knowledge of the technologies and architecture principles required to build complex operational technology systems such as: Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs); Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA); Distributed Control Systems (DCS); Human Machine Interface (HMI); Industrial network ports and protocols (such as TCP/IP, UDP, DNP3, Modbus, IEC 61850, PROFINET, OPC, LonWorks, DALI, BACnet, KNX, EnOcean, etc.); etc;

·       Deep understanding of ICS design considerations with emphasis on human safety and the availability/security of operating environment as well as threats, vulnerabilities, and exploits in ICS environments and appropriate mitigation techniques.

·       Ability to derive security requirements from vaguely formulated business needs;

·       Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce security measures

·       Excellent written and verbal communication skills;

·       Detail-oriented self-starter with a high level of commitment and personal motivation;

·       Knack for prioritizing tasks and working in a fast-paced environment;

·       Knowledge of standards, regulations and legislation governing Information Security, e.g. NIST, ISO 27001, OWASP, ISA 62443;

 

Experience 

·       Minimum 12 years overall IT work experience 

·       Minimum 8 years OT experience 

·       Minimum 5 years experience in OT security architecture experience

Assets (if applicable)

·       Software development experience

·       Experience with Agile and DevOps methodologies 

·       Knowledge of general IT security architecture and technologies including: service-oriented-architectures, mobile technologies including Mobile Device Management (MDM), data-centric design, advanced analytics, AI, Identity and Access Management (IAM) lifecycles, Digital Forensics, End Point Encryption, Encryption Key Management, Database Security, Enterprise Directory Services, IDS, IPS, Next Generation Firewall, Application Firewall, Enterprise Password Vaults , Cloud SaaS /PaaS/IaaS Security, SIEM, etc.

·       Deep knowledge of security foundations: cryptography, Root of Trust, security models, etc. 

·       Experience with NGFW, VPN, IPS/BDS, vulnerability management, access management, SIEM, and endpoint security in OT environments

·       Railroad, transportation, or Global industrial experience is a significant plus

Working Conditions

Occasional business travel (Canada and US) in accordance with CN policy 

About CN

 

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

 

For internal candidates, note that the grade level of the position will depend on the employee\'s experience.

CN requires that all employees be fully vaccinatedagainst COVID-19 and provide proof thereof as a condition of employment. TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Intern, Enterprise Architecture
item.description:
At CN, everydaybrings new and exciting challenges. You can expect an interesting environmentwhere you’re part of making sure ourbusiness is running optimally and safely―helping keep the economy on track. We welcome students who share theirideas, perspectives and understanding of newtechnologies withour teams. In return, we provide the opportunity towork on exciting projects with experienced collaborators who are happy to share their knowledge, all within a mutually-agreed to framework. Youwill be able to thrive in our close-knit, safety-focused culture workingtogether as ONE TEAM. The opportunities we offer are meaningful because thework we do matters. Join us! 

Canadian National Railway Company (CN) is looking for a highly motivated person to fulfill a full-time (40h/week) Intern, Enterprise Architecture position in Canada for summer 2023 (May – August).

Job Summary

The Intern, Enterprise Architecture is responsible for supporting emerging technologies and innovation practices. The incumbent researches the latest technology trends applicable to railroading and has the opportunity to communicate trends and innovations to the larger CN I&T community. The role is exposed to the fundamental workings of the railroad across many business disciplines as well as to Research and Development (R&D), architecture, and solution delivery best practices. The position is performed within a team of experienced thought leaders and passionate professionals that solve exciting enterprise challenges in a fun and collaborative atmosphere. The exceptional breadth of exposure to numerous opportunities from “classic” mainframe systems to the bleeding edge of distributed Artificial Intelligence (AI), from telecom to finance and everything in between provides a unique opportunity to understand the workings of a large supply chain enabler.

Major Responsibilities

  • Learn the key elements of railroading
  • Research technology trends in the railroad and adjacent industries then document how they would be applied
  • Prepare technical radars and reports for specific innovation topics
  • Assess potential suppliers on their product and service offering, including both start-ups and market leaders
  • Support the delivery of proof of concept and prototyping initiatives, including business cases, data gathering, and delivery planning
  • Develop and execute innovative communication strategies for digital tools such as Yammer and SharePoint
  • Create standard templates for research requests
  • Shadow meetings with research partners and suppliers

Requirements

  • Shows initiative and empowers others
  • Identifies opportunities
  • Solves problems using analytical thinking
  • Inspires others with impactful communications and adapts to the audience
  • Collaborates with others
  • Deals with pressure and change by staying calm to quickly adapt to changes
  • Knowledge of Scientific written communication and technology principles
  • Knowledge of AI, Machine Learning, Internet of Things (IoT), Big Data, Computer Vision, advanced analytics, automation, and positioning technologies
  • Knowledge of technologies and practices such as Optimizers, Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAVs), wearables, extended reality, Blockchain, autonomous vehicles, digital twins, edge computing, control towers, data governance, and railroad operations*
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
  • Knowledge of Teams and SharePoint

Education

  • Working towards a Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics, or Business

*Any experience/education/skills/knowledge for these above would be considered as an asset

About CN  

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results. 

CN is an employment equity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Please monitor your email on a regular basis, as communication is primarily made through email.

item.title: Analyst Dataops
item.description:
At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!

 

 

Job Summary

 The role of Analyst DataOps is responsible for the successful analysis and management of the data information generated by technologies, services, and systems within CN or outside CN.

The role ensures that all business requirements are met by team members and projects, and contributes to the global evolution of CN’s I&T.

Clients can be from within CN’s I&T team or direct lines of business.

The Analyst Dataops will work in collaboration with Data Scientist, MLops and DevOps teams to build and improve full-time automated data solutions between systems in the cloud.  

The candidate will also be involved in building test code, design and optimised monitoring tool.  Will be part of the DataOps team and lead after action review for operations support.

 

 

Main Responsibilities

 

·       Build and optimize data pipelines to facilitate the extraction of data from multiple sources and load it into data warehouses.

·       Use automation to streamline data processing

·       Develop, implement, maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality

·       Must be able to identify, analyze and interpret schema, trends, or patterns in complex data.

·       Test and adopt solutions and tools that adhere to the DataOps best practices

·       Improve data development and deployment processes.

·       Implement data security standards that must be applied across the data pipelines.

 

 

 

Working Conditions

The role has standard working conditions in an office environment with a regular workweek from Monday to Friday.

 

Minimum Requirements

 

  • Minimum of 3 years of overall relevant work experience (with a prominent focus on dataops and data analyst skills )
  • Master or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent
  • Strong knowledge in cloud computing (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, DataBricks)
  • Strong knowledge in database ( MySQL, NoSQL, etc)
  • Strong knowledge about coding in Python, Java.
  • Experience working with structured and non-structured data
  • Knowledge in QA
  • Knowledge in rest API and Node API
  • Knowledge of CI/CD tools (Jenkins, Azure Devops, Github, etc.)
  • Knowledge in logs management, application monitoring, infrastructure monitoring
  • Experience with Kubernetes, Kafka and MQ.
  • Experience with Data Orchestration tool (ADF, Databricks Workflow, etc.)

 

 

 

ASSETS

  • Experience with Azure Data Explorer (ADX)
  • Great Communication skills
  • Out of the box thinker
  • Devops Certification
  • PTC and Rail industry experience
  • IoT experience
  • MLOps Experience
  • Knowledge of networking, security and protocol
  • Data Analyst Certification (Azure, Databricks, GCP or another platform),
  • Data Engineer Certification (Azure DP-203, Databricks, GCP or another platform)

 

 

About CN

CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

TheCompany’s vaccination mandate extends to employees of our wholly ownedsubsidiaries as well as CN’s contractors, consultants, agents and suppliers andanyone who accesses CN properties in Canada.

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer for Robotics
item.description:
Description

Position:         Full Stack Web Developer for Robotics
Location:        Kitchener, ON
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent           
Experience:    3+ Years relevant experience
Education:      Bachelor Degree in related field
Division:         OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

 

About the Job:

The OTTO Motors branch of Clearpath is looking for a web software developer to join the Autonomy team.

For this role, we are seeking an individual to help us build and wrap existing tooling for presentation in a web environment. You would work closely with other members of the Autonomy team to expose tools in a manner that is convenient for customers and internal staff.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Implementing new OTTO Motors web tools, including creating technical design documents, technical architecture and application development.
  • Supporting and maintaining existing OTTO Motors web tools, including adding new features, implementing design changes and resolving bugs.
  • Laying the foundation for successful strategies in the future

 

 

About You:

You see the potential in intelligent robotics to change the world, and you want to work where you’ll get to make this happen personally. You want to work for a technology company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You like being the go-to person for technical questions. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Required Experience / Skills:

  • 3+ years of related experience
  • Experience writing HTML5/JavaScript based applications that interface with back-end REST and WebSocket endpoints.
  • Using web frameworks and tools such as React, webpack/vite, npm/yarn
  • Using container systems systems such as Docker
  • Comfortable in a bash terminal on Linux based systems
  • Writing development documentation and using source control and build systems.
  • Working in a collaborative environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagrams, discussion, and examples

Bonus Points For:

  • Server-side development using NodeJS or Python, implementing API\'s and supporting services
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems
  • C++ / Python experience
  • Experience with TypeScript

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Graduate Intern Program - Perception
item.description:
Description

Position:  Graduate Intern Program - Perception
Location:  Kitchener, Ontario (Hybrid) 
Job Type:  Internship
Education: Graduate (Masters or PhD) 
Area of study: Relevant Field of Robotics, Computer Vision, or Machine Learning
Division: OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, machine learning, computer vision and more.


The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Graduate Research Intern you will work on the testing and development of core robotics software responsible for environmental perception and understanding on all our vehicles. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic perception
  • Development of custom SLAM, computer vision, machine learning, target tracking and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new perception algorithms and sensing technology
  • Design and implement new perception systems and algorithms
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems

Additional tasks may include:

  • Collaboration with internal teams including the Simulation Team and Navigation Team
  • Triage and support of live industrial systems in the field

Required Skills:

  • Practical and theoretical knowledge in at least one or more areas of: state estimation, computer vision, SLAM, machine learning, target detection and tracking, robotic perception
  • Proficient software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux
  • Excellent teamwork/communication skills
  • Ability to independently develop high quality software solutions

Bonus points for:

  • Hands-on experience with real autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • ROS, TensorFlow, Gazebo, OpenCV and/or PCL experience
  • Familiarity with graph optimization techniques and libraries
  • Experience with git or other DVCS systems and other software development processes
  • Understanding of sensor error modeling, particularly laser rangefinders and vision systems

 At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Intermediate Program Manager
item.description:
Description

Position:                Intermediate Program Manager           
Location:               Kitchener, ON                          
Job Type:              Full-Time Permanent
Experience:          3+ years’ experience       
Education:            Bachelor\'s
Division:               OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

We are building a robotics platform. We are growing and need to add a new program manager to manage both our internal teams and external relationships with key partners.

As a Program Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating program deliverables and serving as the point of contact between partners and other departments. Your goal is to manage the efforts of team members to ensure our programs are delivered on time and that our partners’ needs are met.

Your Primary Responsibilities will be:

  • Generate and manage the Joint Program Plan from kickoff to product release
  • Scheduling, Task Decomposition, and Resource Management
  • Analyze, evaluate, and mitigate program risks, and produce reports for management and stakeholders
  • Actively manage and expedite critical path tasks
  • Create and maintain a program schedule
  • Work with technical leads to identify:
    • Tasks and Dependencies
    • Resources Requirements (Personnel, Equipment, etc.)
  • Integrate with Software, Hardware and OEM Development Programs
  • Work with the other program managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple programs
  • Identify key requirements needed from cross-functional team, external vendors and partners
  • Track Program/Product Requirements and Specifications
  • Ensure completion of requirements implementation and verification
  • Working with external partners to ensure program success.  Establish and maintain:
    • Joint schedule
    • Joint risk management activities
    • Communication channels with all stakeholders
    • Action logs and tracking actions to completion
  • Risk Assessment and Management
    • Maintain a Risk Register
  • Managerial
    • Issue Escalation
    • Mentorship
    • Conflict Resolution
    • Relationship Management    

Required Technical Skills

  • Project Management Software
    • Gantt Charts (i.e. MS Project)
    • Task and Issue Tracking (i.e. JIRA)
    • Configuration Control
    • Requirements and Specifications tracking
  • Documentation
    • Solid writing skills
    • Good with spreadsheets to communicate complicated status
    • Executive presentations through effective slides
    • Documentation
  • 3 years of project or program management experience from previous work placements (co-ops included)
  • Conflict resolution and people interface skills
  • Experience with direct customer contact

As our next Program Manager, you know how to under promise and over deliver, adapt to changing directions, priorities and personalities, and multiple stakeholders.  You have program management experience from previous work placements. Bonus points for managing engineering related programs with external partners. 

Bonus Points For

  • Mechatronics background
  • Experience in managing partners
  • 1-2 years of engineering design experience from previous work placements
  • The ability to write macros or scripts with Office programs, JIRA or data processing.

At OTTO Motors, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

item.title: Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors
item.description:
Description

Position: Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors               
Location: Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type: Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 2-5 Years Relevant Work Experience
Education: Masters or PhD Degree in a related field
Division: OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Perception Developer to work on the Perception Team in the Vehicle Software Group to focus on the development of sensor calibration algorithms.

Clearpath\'s OTTO Motors robots lead the industry in self-driving materials handling, and you can help us push robotics to the next level of intelligence and performance. This means continually learning, inventing, and implementing new algorithms, all with an emphasis on robust and reliable best practice programming. We\'re looking for people excited to develop the next generation of perception algorithms to tackle the toughest challenges in localization and mapping, calibration, sensing, machine learning, computer vision and more.

The perception team’s primary responsibility is the development of the core robotics software responsible for environmental sensing and understanding on all of our vehicles. As a Perception Developer - Calibration and Sensors you will develop & maintain algorithms and processes for the complete continuous calibration of robotic systems and processing of sensor data. You will be creating solutions to the challenging problems of high accuracy intrinsic and extrinsic calibration of heterogeneous sensor configurations and actuators as well as online calibration and sensor processing and monitoring for a wide range of possible robotic platforms. You will be responsible for evaluating state-of-the-art ideas from academia and industry, and taking these ideas out of the lab and into the real world, identifying opportunities to improve, and developing high-performance software to run in real time on the robots.

About You

For the role of Perception Developer - Calibration we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic calibration solutions for a variety of applications.

Responsibilities:

  • Create robust innovative solutions to the problems of robotic calibration and perception
  • Development of custom calibration, sensor monitoring, sensor filtering, and perception algorithms
  • Evaluation of new sensing technology and robotic platforms
  • Work with production to develop processes for sensor calibration methods
  • Develop integration and unit tests for perception features
  • Supporting deployment and testing of robotic systems
  • Stay up to date with the latest developments in industry and academia 

Skills and experience:

  • Strong theoretical and practical understanding of the challenges and solutions to the problems of robotic system calibration
  • Practical knowledge of sensing technologies including LIDAR, Cameras, IMU, and their error models
  • Familiarity with robotic platforms and their motion models such as differential, ackerman, bicycle, etc.
  • Proficient software development skills in modern C++
  • Proficiency with Linux environment

Bonus Points For:

  • Hands-on experience with real world autonomous systems
  • Experience writing efficient, high performance code
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Proficiency with linear algebra and non-linear optimization including libraries such as ceres solver and Eigen
  • Experience with computer vision libraries such as PCL and OpenCV.
  • Experience with manufacturing tolerances of robotic systems

 

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

As our next Program Manager, you know how to under promise and over deliver, adapt to changing directions, priorities and personalities, and multiple stakeholders.  You have program management experience from previous work placements. item.title: Senior Simulation Developer
item.description:
Description

Position:         Senior Simulation Developer          
Location:         Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type:        Full-Time Permanent
Experience:    2 - 5 years of relevant work experience
Education:      Degree in a related field
Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The OTTO Motors division of Clearpath is looking for a Simulation Developer to work in the Fleet Software Group.

The Fleet Software Group is responsible for the design, development and support of the Fleet Manager and software applications that allow our users to interact with, monitor and support their fleets of OTTO Autonomous Vehicles. This involves participation in the entire product workflow, from customer insight gathering, problem definition, solution proposals, application design, development and support.

For this role we are seeking an individual to develop & maintain software tools and assets used in our simulation stack. You will be working closely with other members of the DevOps, Vehicle Systems, Fleet software development teams as well as many other groups within OTTO Motors, in order to provide robust and easy-to-use solutions to the problems our employees & customers need to solve with their simulation environments and workflows.

About You

For the role of Simulation Developer we are seeking an experienced developer to support, maintain, and extend robotic simulations in a full-stack simulation environment in a small team.  Your work will directly support a variety of internal groups in testing, developing and training.

Responsibilities:

  • Designing and developing new simulation tools and assets.
  • Maintaining and extending existing simulation automation/deployment tools and assets.
  • Improving useability and robustness of our simulation tool set.
  • Writing internal documentation for new and existing simulation tools and assets.
  • Troubleshooting simulation automation/deployment issues and bugs.
  • Supporting development operations, internal tools, and infrastructure.
  • Supporting development systems infrastructure.

 Additional responsibilities may include:

  • Developing, maintaining, and extending simulation plugins, both internal and upstream.
  • Alerting the team and stopping the robots from starting their own revolution.

Skills and experience:

  • Minimum 2-5 years of experience in software development in an enterprise environment.
  • Object-oriented programming experience (C++).
  • Working with Linux/Ubuntu based environments and scripting (Bash, Python 3.5+).
  • Use of emplating formats and markup languages (e.g. XML, YAML, JSON).
  • Using continuous integration (Jenkins/GitLab pipelines) and source control (Git).
  • Diagnosing and narrowing down the source of issues.
  • Working in a collaborative virtual environment, interfacing with other team members regularly, sharing knowledge via diagram, discussion, and example.
  • Creating/maintaining virtual models & environments in a physics based simulator.

Bonus Points For:

  • Other object-oriented programming experience (e.g. C#, Java)
  • Experience with ROS / Robotics Systems.
  • Experience with Gazebo/Unity/Unreal/Isaac simulation.
  • Experience in 3D graphics software and programming.
  • Experience with containers and Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with Nix

Clearpath is committed to supporting a culture of diversity and accessibility across the organization.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, sex, gender identity/expression, veteran status or sexual orientation. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Software Developer
item.description:
Description

Position at Clearpath Robotics

Position: Software Developer 

Location: Waterloo, Ontario          

Experience: 2+ Years relevant work experience         

Education: Undergraduate degree (CS or equivalent)

About Clearpath Robotics 

Clearpath Robotics’ research solutions group is a global leader in unmanned vehicle robotics for research and development, and provides hardware, software, and services to enable self-driving vehicle development, deployment, and operation. Clearpath Robotics works with over 500 of the world’s most innovative brands in over 40 countries, serving markets that span mining, military, agriculture, aerospace, and academia. Visit Clearpath Robotics at www.clearpathrobotics.com.

About the Job

We\'re looking for a Software Developer to leverage their C/C++, Python and Robot Operating System (ROS) skills to harness the potential of our robots and create integration success stories in a wide range of application domains. Your goal is to work with our partners and customers to develop properly engineered solutions, primarily through ROS drivers and cool robot integration code, to unleash the incredible potential of the Clearpath robots. Anyone can write code that solves a single problem, but this job requires someone to develop solutions that are applicable to a wide range of applications and problem domains.

Your primary responsibilities will be:

  • Designing and implementing software for both Clearpath robots and custom robotics applications, primarily through C/C++, Python, ROS and ROS2
  • Developing software to integrate large robot arms onto Clearpath mobile platforms
  • Creating compelling solutions for demonstrations and trade shows
  • Working with potential partners to develop joint solutions, both sensor integrations and SaaS solutions
  • Supporting our Applications Engineering team in assessing and scoping new opportunities
  • Troubleshooting robot issues: on-site, phone, email or internet support

About You

You want to work for a fast-paced growing company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are motivated, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with less than 100% effort. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.

Not only do you write reliable software, but you like the thought of working on projects that interact with the world. You enjoy working with partners and giving back to the open-source community. You\'re looking for a job where you get to interact with a diverse team and learn something new every day.

Required Experience/Skills:

  • 2+ years C/C++ and Python, preferably with exposure to ROS development
  • Experience working in a multidisciplinary team
  • Previous exposure to hardware systems or electromechanical products
  • Working knowledge of the Git version control system
  • Proficiency with Debian Linux based distributions 

Bonus points for:

  • Embedded systems development
  • General mechatronics interest and experience
  • Experience with manipulators and related driver development
  • GUI design and development (especially with React)
  • Experience leading training sessions outside the company
  • Experience with 3D mapping
  • System benchmarking, performance analysis and code complexity reduction
  • Experience with rigorous software testing and continuous integration processes
  • Contributions to open source projects

item.title: Electrical Development Team Lead
item.description:
Description

Position:           Electrical Development Team Lead
Location:          Kitchener, ON
Job Type:          Full-Time Permanent
Experience:     5+ years relevant work experience
Education:       Degree in a related field or equivalent work experience
Division:           OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

You will guide and manage the Electrical Development Engineering team by providing tactical day-to-day guidance and direction; establishing team strategy (objectives, metrics, priorities, and best practices); enabling the team to perform at their best, as well as applying your technical expertise to solve complex problems.  In addition, you will be responsible for significant portions of the electrical system design and implementation for our new and existing products.

The Electrical Development team works closely with our hardware, software, and new product development teams to establish sustainable development and support of our products, providing a robust design to our customers.

In addition, the team will adhere to safety standards and processes such as ISO13849, ISO12100, IEC61508, R15.08, and IEC 3691-4 or similar standards applicable to mobile robots.

Furthermore, the team is a contributor to defining our product requirements and is an influencer of our product roadmap.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Delegate, schedule, and manage tasks within the Electrical Development Team’s domain
  • Providing performance and development feedback
  • Ensuring consistent quality of service and deliverables from the Electrical Development group
  • Working with and improving our existing processes for Electrical design and development on our products
  • Adapting and improving the overall service and performance
  • Develop working relationships with vendors to help ensure OTTO motors is selecting the highest quality and latest technology parts in our products
  • Lead some technical projects yourself
  • Industrial control system design and architecture with an eye to ISO 13849, ANSI B56.5, IEC 61508 and others as needed.
  • Support high-level vehicle architecture design
  • First level of triage for electrical issues
  • Verifying basic robot functionality (ROS skills as needed)
  • Prototype assembly (Build parts of the robot as needed) 
  • Design Documentation (Meeting minutes, requirements definition, architecture documents, controls analysis, CAD, PLM, internal troubleshooting, assembly and installation documentation)
  • Write and execute good validation and test  plans for new vehicle technologies that make clear and actionable conclusions
  • Be knowledgeable in the robot product lifecycle, and bring-in feedback from all relevant parties at the right time.

Required skills:

  • Degree in engineering, computer science, robotics, or a related field with applicable background
  • 1-2+ years’ experience in a management role in an engineering environment 
  • 5+ years of experience in electrical engineering roles
  • Effective decision making
  • Strong communicator
  • Project and resource management experience
  • Technical acuity (e.g., ideas contributor to implementation strategies, product features and requirements)
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and manage deadlines.
  • Experience with hands-on prototyping and troubleshooting of electromechanical systems
  • Able to understand and communicate concepts readily via sketches, block diagrams, flow charts, and technical writing
  • Able to work in Canada

Bonus Points for:

  • Experience working with industrial robots.
  • Experience in designing to comply with the European, US and Canadian standards, particularly FCC and CE or liaising with NRTLs
  • Experience with design for functional safety (ISO 12100, EN 61508, etc.)
  • Knowledge of WHMA/IPC-A-620
  • Experience with C Language software solutions on embedded platforms e.g. C++ and Python
  • Experience with the V-model or other similar verification and validation methodologies 
  • Working knowledge of aspects of mobile robotics such as perception, planning, controls, and navigation
  • Power distribution and motor systems
  • Low speed digital/analog circuit design
  • Cable assembly design
  • PCBA design, microprocessor and network integration (CAN, Ethernet, ModBUS etc.)
  • Familiarity with industrial material handling vehicles
  • Experience with ROS
  • Past hands-on experience with mobile robots, industrial trucks, or AGCs as an operator or developer

item.title: Partner Marketing Manager
item.description:
Description

Position: Partner Marketing Manager               
Location: Kitchener, Ontario             
Job Type: Full-Time Permanent
Experience: 5+ Years Relevant Work Experience
Education: Graduate Degree in Related Field
Division: OTTO Motors


About OTTO Motors, a division of Clearpath Robotics

At OTTO Motors, we believe material handling is one of the most dangerous and unproductive parts of modern industrial operations. Our mission is to create safer, more productive and fulfilling workplaces with autonomous material handling technology. Most recently, OTTO Motors was recognized among the top 1% of Canada’s highest-performing global private companies by Communitech. Our loyal customers are also the most recognizable brands in the world and trust OTTO Motors to fulfill their mission-critical material handling needs: General Electric, Toyota, Hershey, Caterpillar, Berry Global, and more. For more information about us, visit www.ottomotors.com.


About the Job:

The global market for mobile robotics is expected to exceed $224 billion by 2030, according to global technology market advisory firm ABI Research. OTTO Motors is at the center of this enormous market growth fuelled by labor shortages, pressure to compete internationally and the modernization of manufacturing facilities. The Channel Sales and Enablement team is a strategic sales organization that is responsible for building, selling and supporting our vastly growing partner and dealer network who are on a mission to deploy autonomous mobile robots in manufacturing facilities and warehouses around the world.

As a Partner Marketing Manager, we are looking for you to bring your unmatched work ethic, collaboration, enthusiasm and your strong passion for the customer to cultivate profound growth within our partner and dealer network. In this role, you will lead OTTO Motors’ channel marketing efforts and demand generation strategies to grow the brand and revenue for both the partner and OTTO Motors. This role requires having an understanding of best-in-class marketing practices, relationship building skill sets, and experience in implementing joint strategies that will empower our partners to bring market-defining solutions to customers. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth as you work closely with highly complex partner organizations, build strong relationships in the C-Suite and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders. OTTO Motors is proud to provide all employees flexibility in that you can work from home.

 

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain trusted relationships with partners and align their goals and strategies with OTTO Motors’ to create joint marketing initiatives that will expand global market share and achieve channel pipeline targets
  • Design and execute a mix of marketing campaigns that are proven to achieve the business objectives that the partner and OTTO Motors team identified
  • Monitor results, drive pipeline reviews and coach partners to continuously address campaign challenges in order to achieve partner sales goals
  • Advocate for the partner internally to help prioritize the partners’ marketing-related goals while also acting as the partners’ main marketing point of contact 
  • Work very closely with the Channel Sales and Enablement Team and your colleagues on the marketing team to leverage and expand marketing activities within the channel

 

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Proven channel marketing experience in tech, OEM or dealer organization
  • Experience working in fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and has the ability to clearly define, diagnose and execute an appropriate solution
  • Relationship management experience and skill sets to interact confidently with senior leaders of partner organizations
  • Proven experience building and executing launch plans and demand generation programs, including: email, video, webinar, event, lunch and learns and digital programs
  • Data driven mindset and has ability to manage pipeline targets, track lead progression in the funnel and ensure strategy alignment with business priorities
  • Excellent ability to communicate marketing messages and technical concepts through various mediums
  • BA/BS in marketing, business or related fields preferred

At OTTO Motors, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility. We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. We are currently selling more robots than we can build! We need a Quality Analyst to take responsibility in ensuring our core products are built with components of the utmost quality as well as ensuring our core products are capable of handling specified end-user requirements. You want to work for a small company that thinks big and dreams huge.  You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied doing a job less than 100%. You want to be surrounded by people like you; creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work.  You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems. Oh, and you have some form of higher education with the common sense to back it up.

item.title: Systems Integrator
item.description:
Description

Position:             Systems Integrator    
Location:             Kitchener, ON     
Job Type:            Full-Time Permanent
Experience:        2-5 years of relevant work experience
Education:          Electrical/Mechanical/Industrial Controls/Mechatronics/Systems Engineering related field
Division:              OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)

OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

The Systems Engineering (SE) team works closely with our Project Management Office (PMO) within our professional services organization to deliver business value to our end users, channel partners, and for OTTO Motors.  SEs design and implement fleets of OTTO autonomous mobile robots (AMR) and software at our customer facilities. In addition, the SE team delivers training to our integration partners and end-users, and evaluates use cases to establish guidelines, standards, and best practices for how OTTO Motors products can be used by the market, specifically by our integrator network. Furthermore, the SE team is a major contributor to defining our product requirements and is a major influencer of our product roadmap.

Primary responsibilities:

  • detailed design of AMR systems using OTTO Motors products to meet the customer requirements; this includes workflow design, attachment design, map design and development/modification middle layer software logic using Ignition OPC/UA and/or PLC logic design and modification
  • authoring & executing acceptance test plans for validation of system functionality and performance;
  • commissioning & integration of AMR systems at client facilities throughout the world; this includes traveling to customer or integration partner facility for on-site deployment and integration with facility side automation equipment
  • optimizing system performance through analysis, simulation, and experimentation;
  • project planning for the deliverables and work packages you own;
  • communicating technical details and status to the customer and broader project team;
  • consulting with integration partners on all of the above
  • delivery of training to integration partners as well as end users
  • troubleshooting software & hardware technical issues using internal tools available; solving new and challenging technical problems related to the above

Additional responsibilities:

  • authoring new product requirements based on the lessons learned from your design and commissioning activities;
  • working with the systems engineering team to improve department tools, processes, and working relationships with other departments;
  • ability to travel for business within North America, Europe and Asia; ~35 - 45 % travel commitment over the year (travel mostly contained to Canada and USA).  Trips to site would typically be 2 weeks on - 2 weeks off during the project integration phase.

About You

You want to work for a fast-moving company that thinks big and dreams huge. You are driven, view work as more than just a job, and are never satisfied with a project left half-done. You want to be surrounded by people who are creative, fun-loving, and passionate about their work. You are motivated by making an impact on your workplace and you thrive on challenging and rewarding problems.  You have a customer-first mentality and strive to exceed customer expectations.

Your mastery comes from years of experience in designing and integrating complex systems solutions for industrial automation applications. You are able to represent a complex system via a simplified block diagram representation to convey the objective and details to the end-user systematically.

Required background:

  • 3+ years of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience commissioning & integrating industrial automated equipment or software that interfaces to the equipment
  • college/university diploma or degree in an engineering, design, or industrial controls type of field
  • experience working directly with clients/end-users
  • experience in troubleshooting and repairing electro-mechanical systems/subsystems
  • interpretation & design analysis of mechanical drawings and electrical schematics
  • PLC design and integration experience
  • demonstrated ability to work with Linux
  • planning and organization (how to approach and solve a problem, work breakdown to achieve the end goal, etc.)
  • strong communicator, verbal and written
  • self-motivated and organized with a keen eye for detail

Bonus for experience:

  • training users of automated equipment/software
  • authoring and modifying software code (python, C++, or other)
  • experience with inductive Automation Ignition OPC/UA software
  • Have Spanish as first, second or third language.

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression.  If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.

item.title: Account Executive
item.description:
Description

Position:          Account Executive 
Location:          Remote - North America
Experience:      5 + Years’ experience selling technical products, preferably material handling solutions
Division:          OTTO Motors

About OTTO™ Motors (Division of Clearpath Robotics)
OTTO™ Motors is a growing, disruptive company, making material handling in industrial settings safer, easier, and more efficient through development of hardware and software that automates movement of goods in busy factories and warehouses. The company’s industry-leading self-driving technology provides automated and on-demand material handling in the most demanding industrial environments, spanning automotive, medical device, aerospace, logistics, and more. Customers trusting their mission-critical material handling needs to OTTO Motors include Fortune 100 brands GE, Toyota, and Caterpillar. For more information visit www.ottomotors.com.

About the Job

Clearpath is automating the world and we need your help.  Got what it takes?

We’re looking for a passionate, self-driven, and motivated Account Executive (AEx) to join our OTTO Motors Sales Organization. We strive to become the ‘renaissance people’ of deal-making, with proven skills across all account functions: strategic account planning, business development, direct technical sales, and account administration. This is a remote position, with 50% travel required – you will receive support from the team regardless of location.

You will:

  • Pursue target accounts in your territory, infiltrate those accounts at the highest decision-making level, and secure that business.
  • Devise account strategies that leverage OTTO solutions and go-to-market strategy to expand OTTO within target accounts
  • Develop business relationships across the organization elevating Clearpath’s position within the executive ranks. 
  • Work with clients to identify materials handling automation opportunities in their facilities, promote and demonstrate the OTTO solution and engage the customers in projects with compelling business cases.    
  • Be responsible for pipeline growth and revenue growth in your territory.
  • Devise your personal strategy to systematically conquer your slice of the globe... and we will do everything we can to support you along the way!  
  • The AEx reports directly to the Director of Sales. You will be paid a base salary plus commissions and benefits.

Ideal Sales Characteristics:

Our next AEx is a sharp, articulate and persuasive person, who is 100% comfortable spending their days talking to highly-technical Production Engineers, Facility Directors and VP and C Level Executives.

  • Coachability – ability to understand feedback and change behavior
  • Curiosity – ability and desire to ask probing questions
  • Prior Success – based on previous sales results and/or ambition
  • Intelligence – ability to become a subject matter expert
  • Emotional Intelligence – self-awareness, self-management, social awareness and relationship building with others 
  • Passion – brings an intense enthusiasm to the team
  • Work Ethic – willingness to put in the extra effort to succeed
  • Preparation – technical aptitude of product and market/buyer understanding
  • Competitiveness – a drive to succeed that enables higher performance
  • Adaptability - ability to adapt and succeed in a fast-paced environment
  • Culture Fit – fit with company core values and culture

Required Skills and Experience: 

  • University degree in a STEM, Business or related field
  • Minimum 5+ years of relevant industry experience in a variety of technical roles including Applications Engineering, Project/Program Management and Technical Sales
  • Proven success in Business Development, Direct Sales and/or Key Account Management
  • Experience selling to mid market and enterprise organizations
  • Experience with CRM products such as Salesforce.com is an asset
  • Excellent communication skills, and the ability to deliver compelling presentations to prospects, customers, and partners.
  • Strategic thinker who is also hands-on to get results
  • Ability to travel to customers 25-50% of the time.

What’s in it for you:

  • Work-life balance - vacation, flexible long weekends, half-day birthdays and wellness days
  • Flexibility in when you work, core hours are 10am-3pm EST
  • Competitive salary and career growth opportunities
  • Comprehensive benefits for you and your family to support your health and wellness
  • Additional perks to get you set up at home/work
  • Opportunity to make a difference with the world’s deadliest, dirtiest and dangerous jobs
  • Amazing co-workers to laugh and have fun

At Clearpath, we are committed to building and supporting a culture of diversity, inclusion, and accessibility.  We hire the best talent regardless of race, color, creed, national origin, ancestry, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and expression. If you require special accommodation to complete any portion of the application or interview process, please contact 1-800-301-3863.
